abstract.p: Oriental Lamp Shade Co introduces line of animal-print lampshades; photo (S)

block.p: It is now possible to live in a room where every surface is covered with spots. There are fake animal print sofas, rugs, pillows and, as of last month, lampshades, too. Ron Murakami, owner of two Oriental Lamp Shade Company stores in Manhattan, makes paper shades in leopard, zebra and snakeskin patterns -- it's a trend, he said. The shades, left, range in diameter from 5 inches to 18 inches ($18 to $48). Oriental Lamp Shade, 816 Lexington Avenue (62nd Street) and 223 West 79th Street.
